report:
Techno-economic optimization : Report

Welcome to the module simulation report of the Techno-economic optimization (TEO) module in the EMB3RS platform. The TEO module determines the cost optimal matching of sinks and the sources. The optimal capacity of the technologies and storages, and their optimal operation is determined while considering several constraints. The techno-economic optimization of your case has been succesfully completed. The results of the analysis are presented in this report. The report contains several sections. Each of them will present tables, plots and some text describing the main results of your case. For a detailed analysis of the results, you can download the results of the TEO module from the platform.

1. Capacity of Sources and Sinks

The installed capacity of technologies all the sources and sinks for the final year in the analysis period is shown in the table below. The installed capacity can be used to analyse which technologies are chosen by the TEO for each sink and source.

Final Source and Sink Capacities in kW

The installed capacity of technologies for all grid specific technologies

Grid specific technologies are used a back up technologies when the excess heat from the sources in not adequate to meet the sink heat or cold demands.

The installed capacity of technologies for all grid specific technologies is visualized in the graph below.

3. Annual Heat generation

4. Intra Annual Heat and Cold Generation

The intra annual heat and cold generation provides insights about the heat generation from each technology in each timestep. The length of the intrannual timestep is defined by the user. This result can be used to identify the base and peak load technologies for each sink and source. Furthermore, it also highlights the hourly variation of the demand profiles and the supply dispatch needed to meet it.

Intra Annual Heat Generation for all Sources

Intra annual heat generation for all sources is visualized in the graph below.

Intra Annual Heat and Cold consumption for each Sink

Intra annual heat and cold consumption for each sink is visualized in the graphs below. It can be expanded by clicking on the button

7. Costs

The techno-economic optimization from the TEO determines a cost optimal solution for matching sources and sinks. Hence, the costs are an important result from the TEO. The costs are split into Capital costs and operational costs. These are further presented in the next subsections.

7.1 Capital Costs

The capital costs of all technologies are presented in the table below.

8. Storage operation

The techno-economic optimization considers heat storage while determining the optimal matching of sources and sinks.The annual cpacities of the heat storage have been presented befpore. However, the intra annual operation of the storage is necessary to analyze the dispatch of the systems and how the variability of excess heat vailability is balanced out in the system.

The intrannual storage level of each storage are visualized in the graphs below. This shows the stored energy in the storage in every timestep.

The intrannual storage charge and discharge, i.e. the cycling of each storage are visualized in the graphs below. The negative values indicate discharging and the positive values indicate charging. This shows the actual operation of the storage in every timestep.
